meanings.definition: The disturbance of sedimentary deposits by living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Earthworms are a common cause of bioturbation in soil.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study bioturbation to understand how organisms affect the earth's surface.
meanings.sent3: The ants' bioturbation turned the garden into a chaotic mess!
meanings.sent4: The bioturbation caused by the burrowing animals resembled a miniature earthquake.
meanings.sent5: The bioturbation of the sand by crabs created intricate patterns on the beach.

meanings.definition: The mixing of soil or sediment layers by biological activity.
meanings.sent1: Plant roots contribute to bioturbation by loosening the soil.
meanings.sent2: Bioturbation plays a crucial role in nutrient cycling in ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The bioturbation caused by the playful puppies made gardening a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The bioturbation of the layers by earthworms was like nature's own blender.
meanings.sent5: The bioturbation in the pond created a rich habitat for various organisms.
